comments:
I have not been able to replicate this problem but I got the following 
exception when closing a text editor. The project I tried this one was out of 
synch with the file system when this  occured.

STEPS
1) Create a project
2) Get it out of synch
3) Add a txt file
4) Enter and save some text
5) Add Task
6) Close the editor
7) Reopen by double clicking on the task
8) Close the editor

Log: Tue Jan 22 10:05:35 EST 2002
2 org.eclipse.ui 2 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: 
org.eclipse.ui.

The stack trace looks like you were double-clicking from the Navigator, not the 
task list. Are the steps correct?

Judging by the stack trace this appears to be the case but I still am not able 
to replicate this.

I tried and couldn't reproduce it either. What was the way to get the project 
out of synch? Did you add some files?

The project was made out of synch by deleting several directories using windows 
explorer that were children of the project.

I tried creating the text file in a package I deleted... it worked fine for me.
I'm closing it for now. If there is a reproducible test case, it will be 
reopened again.
